reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
reference.title: Shared Options
reference.shortdesc: Many Euca2ools commands share a set of common parameters. This table details these shared options.

row.entry:
Read credentials and cloud settings from the specified config file.
Default: $HOME/.eucarc or /etc/euca2ools/eucarc.
Prints what the command sends to the server and what it receives from the server. Use when you're trying to debug Euca2ools.
Display the manual page for the command.
Region to direct requests to. Only valid for EC2 endpoints. Meaning what?
URL of the cloud to connect to. Expects an EC2 endpoint /services/Eucalyptus. What does this sentence mean?
Display the version of this tool

The protocol.
Valid Values: tcp | udp | icmp
Range of ports for the rule (specified as "from-to").
ICMP type and code specified as "type:code"
Group from which traffic is authorized by the rule.
User ID for the source group.

The source subnet for the rule.
Default: 0.0.0.0/0
12-digit user ID of the person who is bundling the image.
Path to the user's PEM-encoded certificate.
Path to user's PEM-encoded private key.
The prefix for the bundle image files.

ID of the kernel you want to associate with the image. You can override this ID in and at runtime.
If you are bundling a kernel image, set to true.

ID of the ramdisk to be associated with the image. You can override this ID in and at runtime.
If you are bundling a ramdisk image, set to true.
Product codes to be associated with the image.

Default block device mapping for the image. The format of the mapping is a comma-separated list of key=value pairs. Scot's notes say: "sda=(/dev/sdf=none) no block device mapping" and "Google block device mapping (see CLI ref for EC2)" Uh...?

Directory to store the bundled image in. We recommend that you include this option where allowed. Scot's notes: "on your machine where you're running the command from where you want it to go."
Default: /tmp
Path to the cloud's X.509 certificate.

Target architecture for the image.
Default: x86_64
Valid values: i386 | x86_64
Run in batch mode. This is for compatibility only, and has no effect.
Working directory where bundle should be generated
Size of the image in MB
Bundle all directories, including mounted filesystems.
Do not add instance metadata to the bundled image.
Comma-separated list of directories to exclude.
Comma-separated list of directories to include.
Path to mounted volume to bundle.
Path to the fstab to be bundled with image.
Generate fstab to bundle in image.
Access key ID of the owner of the bucket
Secret key used to sign the upload policy
Expiration, in hours, for the generated upload policy. Default value is 24.

When set to true, the instance is not shut down before creating the image. When this option is used, file system integrity on the created image cannot be guaranteed.
Valid values: true | false
Delete the bucket containing the image.

Filter for limiting the results. See the table in the Available Filters section for a list of filters. Use quotation marks if the value has a space ("name=value example"). On a Windows system, use quotation marks even without a space in the value ("name=value").

section.p: Eucalyptus does not return any message.
